message: Dear God, can't you people separate your personal, anecdotal experiences, from the aggregate data that is accumulated by the studies. Have you not heard the phrase """"exception to the rule."""" I'm glad your formula fed baby is smart, but that doesn't negate the conclusions drawn from the study. The inability to recognize this is incredibly self centered and reflects a serious lack of critical thinking ability.

Obviously these places don't care for the animals. How many times must it be shown that these animals are suffering. For shame on all these places and the owners with only one concern - their huge bank accounts.
I started funding this on kickstarter and put together a high end gaming system for it. The pre-alpha is fantastic and the development they are releasing is fantastic in both graphics and gameplay.

i guess you've never heard of the US black budget? i mean you're talking about two different animals here. Russia had just as many issues in Afghanistan as we did. guerilla warfare is always a threat to a large bulky military, that's how the Americans won the Revolutionary War for the most part. we had the same problems in Vietnam and in Iraq and Afghanistan. but wars between two """"equally"""" matched large nations are not even comparable. you're oversimplifying far too much. to win, they would have to invade us, not just repel an invasion. we DO have functional stealth, I'm surprised you dont realize that. we invented stealth almost forty years ago. China hasnt come close to matching our technology from 20 years ago. same with Russia. China has one advantage, a large army. Russia has one advantage, a more robust cyberwarfare department. in every other category, we are superior.

Well, matcha IS green tea... just powdered. Personally, I like to mix a little of it into my green tea leaves before steeping. The leaves and matcha together really work to each bring out the flavor in the other. Also, baking with matcha is the bomb. Homemade green tea cheesecake is crazy tasty.
